data.title: Albert King would have been a 100 years old this year - appreciation
data.meta_description:
[MEDIA]
A fine gig,  The Flying V was getting wildly out of tune though.
data.text:
Thursday and Friday Night in San Francisco. I lived off those for a while after someone turned me onto them long ago. I chased down some other stuff for sure but that stuff was the bomb.

I love every version of that song I’ve heard (esp EC’s and SRV’s). I think it’s just a great song. One of my favorite blues numbers for sure!

So many excellent Albert offerings. A few of my favorites...

Albert King – Born Under A Bad Sign

Label: Mobile Fidelity Sound Lab – UDCD 577

Series: Original Master Recording, Ultradisc II

Format: CD, Album, Reissue, Remastered, 24k Gold

Country: US

Released: 1993

Genre: Blues

Albert King – Years Gone By

Label: Stax – SCD-8522-2

Format: CD, Album, Reissue, Stereo

Country: USA & Canada

Released: 1989

Genre: Funk / Soul, Blues

Style: Rhythm & Blues, Soul

Albert King – I'll Play The Blues For You

Label: Stax – SXSA-3009-6

Format: SACD, Album, Reissue

Country: US

Released: 2004

Genre: Funk / Soul, Blues

Style: Electric Blues

Albert King – The Big Blues

Label: King Records – KCD-852

Format: CD, Album, Reissue

Country: US

Released: 1988

Genre: Blues

Style: Electric Blues

Albert King – Live Wire / Blues Power

Label: Mobile Fidelity Sound Lab – MFCD 838

Series: Original Master Recording

Format: CD, Album, Reissue, Remastered

Country: US

Released: 1987

Genre: Funk / Soul, Blues

Style: Rhythm & Blues, Soul

I am a Freddie King guy....The Texas Cannonball.....but I love albert as well. Great player...that Flying V strings upside down.....yet The Velvet Bulldozer was a great one!!!!! I have an old old Stax Born Under A Bad Sign....its incredible....all his stuff is great.....BB Freddie Albert you can never go wrong with any of these guys....3 Kings of The Blues for sure!!!!!!!!!!!!

Available video Material: Officially - only two! full (not so full) performances have been released

AlbertKing - Live In Sweden (From a 1980 Stockholm performance)

Albert King w. SRV - In Session (From a 1983 studio session / jam§ allegedly tthree hours of footage exists, so the released show is severely cut)

Unofficial - pro shot footage - as of yet - hello, any company going make an official video anthology?

Maintenance Shop Blues (Live 1981 show, Albert plays with one bandaged finger on his fretting hand)

Live at Paleo Folk Festival (Switzerland 1984)

Japan Blues Carnival (1989, 35 minutes, opening for B.B. King)

Live At Ohne Filter (1992 in Bremen, Germany)

Partials:

Live At The Fillmore 9/1970

Live At Wattstax 1972

John Mayall & The Bluesbreakers - 20 Years Anniversary

B.B. King & Friends - Live (1987 - not too much screentime for Albert, many other guests)
